page.title: 03Life in Faldingworth Today
page.content: It is very quiet living here especially away from the main road. There have been several crashes on the sharp bends and some people think there should be a by-pass. Having a{Village Hall}is a great advantage and many people use its facilities. The{Church}and the{Chapel also help to foster a community spirit. People spend a lot of time looking after their homes and gardens and their children often help. Some people visit one of the two village pubs in the evening or stay in to watch television. Occasionally they will go to Market Rasen, Lincoln, Grimsby or Gainsborough to use facilities there. Most people find it necessary to have their own transport.
